utils.data.logger module

class utils.data.logger.MyLogger(logging, epochs)[source]

Bases: Callback

Integration of logging of each epoch on existent logger

on_epoch_begin(epoch, logs=None)[source]

Called at the start of an epoch.

Subclasses should override for any actions to run. This function should only be called during TRAIN mode.

Parameters:

  • epoch – Integer, index of epoch.

  • logs – Dict. Currently no data is passed to this argument for this method but that may change in the future.

on_epoch_end(epoch, logs=None)[source]

Called at the end of an epoch.

Subclasses should override for any actions to run. This function should only be called during TRAIN mode.

Parameters:

  • epoch – Integer, index of epoch.

  • logs – Dict, metric results for this training epoch, and for the validation epoch if validation is performed. Validation result keys are prefixed with val_. For training epoch, the values of the Model’s metrics are returned. Example: {‘loss’: 0.2, ‘accuracy’: 0.7}.

on_train_batch_end(batch, logs=None)[source]

Called at the end of a training batch in fit methods.

Subclasses should override for any actions to run.

Note that if the steps_per_execution argument to compile in tf.keras.Model is set to N, this method will only be called every N batches.

Parameters:

  • batch – Integer, index of batch within the current epoch.

  • logs – Dict. Aggregated metric results up until this batch.

utils.data.logger.log_initial_params(log, PATHS, FLAGS, PARAMS)[source]

Log parameters (default and user input)

Parameters:

  • log – logger object

  • PATHS – dictionary with paths

  • FLAGS – dictionary with flags

  • PARAMS – dictionary with params

Returns:

None

utils.data.logger.logger_initialize(PATHS, i)[source]

Create logger

Parameters:

  • PATHS – dictionary with paths

  • i – iteration index in user defined list

Returns:

logger and handler object

utils.data.reader module

utils.data.reader.prepare_snapshot(flow, path_mean, flag_control, flag_type, N_t)[source]

Prepares snapshot matrix for runner

Parameters:

  • flow – dictionary containing velocity snapshots, time array and Re

  • flag_control – 1 if control is included in flow, 0 otherwise

  • flag_type – type of flow

  • path_mean – path of mean flow

  • N_t – number of snapshots to use from snapshot matrix

Returns:

snapshot matrix, time array and control vector

utils.data.reader.read_csv(PATHS, FLAGS, PARAMS, i)[source]

Reads input list with variables selected from the user that are not to be maintained at default values from json files.

Parameters:

  • PATHS – dictionary with default paths

  • FLAGS – dictionary with default flags

  • PARAMS – dictionary with default parameters

  • i – index of list that is to be evaluated for this iteration of the code

Returns:

updated PATHS, FLAGS and PARAMS

utils.data.reader.read_flow(path_grid, path_flow)[source]

Loads flow and grid .h5 data into different dictionaries. Flow contains velocity components in snapshot matrix form (rows spatial points, columns time instants), time and Re; grid contains X, Y and mask B matrices.

Parameters:

  • path_grid – relative path of grid

  • path_flow – relative path of flow dataset

Returns:

grid and flow dictionaries

utils.data.reader.read_json()[source]

Reads default variables from several json files. Their PATH is hard-coded.

Returns:

PATHS, FLAGS and PARAMS dictionaries containing all user-defined variables required for the code to run

utils.data.reader.read_latent_space(path_latent)[source]

Reads latent space data into dictionary

Parameters:

  • path_latent – path of latent dataset

  • flag_control – 1 if control is included in flow, 0 otherwise

Returns:

dictionary containing latent space, time array and control vector

utils.data.reader.update_user_vars(path_flow, FLAGS, PARAMS, grid=[], flow=[])[source]

Include in FLAGS and PARAMS dictionaries variables about flow dataset

Parameters:

  • path_flow – relative path of flow dataset or latent space

  • grid – dictionary containing X, Y and body mask grids

  • flow – dictionary containing velocity snapshots, time and Re

  • FLAGS – dictionary with flags

  • PARAMS – dictionary with parameters

Returns:

FLAGS, PARAMS

  • it – iteration number in csv list

  • OUT – dictionary

  • flag_AE_DYN – AE or DYN flag

Saves dynamica predictor model with pickle

Parameters:

  • it – iteration number in csv list

  • DYN – dynamical predictor model class

  • flag_DYN – type of dynamical predictor (LSTM or NARX)

utils.data.transformer module

utils.data.transformer.CNNAE2raw(U)[source]

Transforms dataset from AE shape (Nt,Nx,Ny,K) to snapshot matrix shape (NxNyK,Nt)

Parameters:

U – dataset in AE shape

Returns:

dataset in snapshot matrix shape

utils.data.transformer.flow2window(D, t, t_PW)[source]

Re-shapes snapshot matrix (N_v, N_t) into PW format (N_w, N_v, w_prop). w_prop can also be interchanged for w_p :param D: snapshot matrix (N_v, N_t) :param t: time sequence of snapshot matrix D (N_t, 1) :param t_PW: time sequence of PW (N_w, w_prop) :return: snapshot matrix in window shape

utils.data.transformer.get_control_vector(flow, flag_flow, flag_control)[source]

Reshape control vector depending on flow configuration

Parameters:

  • flow – dictionary containing control coordinates, among others

  • flag_flow – type of flow flag

  • flag_contro – 1 if flow configuration is controlled, 0 otherwise

Returns:

control vector (N_t, N_c)

utils.data.transformer.get_mask_boundaries(Mask)[source]

Retrieves 2D indices of mask at body boundary

Parameters:

Mask – (N_y, N_x) grid containing 1s on body and 0 otherwise

Returns:

indices to the right, top, left and bottom of the body boundary

utils.data.transformer.raw2CNNAE(grid, D, flag_train=0, flag_control=0, b=0)[source]

Transforms dataset from snapshot matrix shape (NxNyK,Nt) to AE shape (Nt,Nx,Ny,K)

Parameters:

  • grid – dictionary containing X,Y grids and body mask

  • D – snapshot matrix

  • flag_train – True if 70/30 splitting is to be done, False otherwise

  • flag_control – True if control parameters are to be considered, False otherwise

  • b – control vector, if required

Returns:

transformed snapshot matrix and control vector

utils.data.transformer.raw2dyn(t, z, PARAMS, flag_control, b=array([[0.]]), flag_train=1)[source]

Converts state vector (and control vector) into shape required by dynamical predictors (tapped delay and prediction windows)

Parameters:

  • t – time vector (N_t, 1)

  • z – state vector (N_t, N_z)

  • PARAMS – dictionary containing parameters

  • flag_control – 1 if control should be considered, 0 otherwise

  • b – control vector (N_t, N_c)

  • flag_train – 1 if train-val splitting is to be done, 0 otherwise

Returns:

tapped delay line and prediction window for both state vector and control vector (if any)

utils.data.transformer.window2flow(Dw)[source]

Re-shapes snapshot matrix in PW format (N_w, N_v, w_prop) into raw format (N_v, N_t). w_prop can also be interchanged for w_p :param Dw: snapshot matrix in window shape :return: snapshot matrix in raw shape

utils.data.transformer.window2zcat(X, w_pe)[source]

Re-shapes state vector from PW approach (N_w, N_t, N_z) to concatenated format (N_w * N_t,N_z). Required for error estimation

Parameters:

  • X – state vector in PW shape

  • n_p – number of time instants in PW to consider

Returns:

state vector in concatenated shape
